metadata.feature_description: Client-side page management interface with React components

steps.action: Navigate to Pages section in PersonaBar
steps.expected: Page tree should display with all pages in hierarchical structure
steps.actual: Page tree rendered correctly showing 11 pages (Home, Our Products, Activity Feed, News, Community, Search Results, 404 Error Page, Wiki Test, Groups, Test Page One, Test Page Two) with expand/collapse controls

steps.action: Click on 'Our Products' page in tree
steps.expected: Page details panel should update to show selected page information
steps.actual: Details panel updated immediately showing Our Products page with correct metadata (Page ID: 22, Title: Our Products - Cavalier Electronics, Description, Keywords)

steps.expected: Permissions grid should display with role-based permissions
steps.actual: Permissions tab displayed full permissions grid with roles (Administrators, Content Editors, Content Managers, Everyone, Registered Users) and permission columns (View, Add, Content, Copy, Delete, Export, Import, Manage, Navigate, Edit Tab)

steps.expected: Advanced settings should display with sub-tabs
steps.actual: Advanced tab displayed with Modules, Appearance, S.E.O., and More sub-tabs. Modules list showed 6 modules on the page (XHD 6400, XHD JR1, XHD 9400, Products Banner, Text/HTML, Content Layout)

steps.action: Drag 'Test Page Two' and drop it onto 'Test Page One'
steps.expected: Page should be moved to become a child of Test Page One
steps.actual: Page was successfully moved. 'Test Page Two' became a child of 'Test Page One', breadcrumb updated to 'TEST PAGE ONE > TEST PAGE TWO', and 'Page updated successfully' message appeared

steps.expected: Page should be moved under Groups
steps.actual: Page successfully moved under Groups. Tree structure updated, breadcrumb showed 'GROUPS > TEST PAGE TWO', Page Parent updated to 'Groups'

steps.expected: UI should adapt to smaller screen
steps.actual: UI adapted to mobile viewport - page tree and details panel remained visible but compressed for smaller screen

steps.expected: UI should adapt to tablet screen size
steps.actual: UI adapted to tablet viewport - page tree displayed alongside details panel with appropriate spacing

steps.expected: Search results should filter in real-time
steps.actual: Search performed instantly. Title changed to 'Page Search Results', showed '6 PAGES FOUND' with matching pages (Wiki Test, Test Page Two, Test Page One, News SubPage Test, Test Normal Page, Publish Test Page). Each result displayed thumbnail, name, URL path, Page Type, Publish Status, Workflow, and Tags

steps.action: Clear the page Name field (required field) and click Save
steps.actual: Validation error displayed: 'Tab Name is Empty' toast message appeared with error icon. Name field highlighted with red border indicating validation failure
Warning dialog appeared: 'Are you sure you want to close? Changes have been made and will be lost. Do you wish to continue?' with 'Go Back' and 'Continue' buttons

steps.expected: Changes should be discarded and original values restored
steps.actual: Changes were discarded. Page name restored to 'Test Page Two', Save button became disabled, page tree showed correct name again

steps.expected: Page details should load with appropriate loading indication
steps.actual: Page details loaded instantly. Details panel updated immediately with Home page information (Page ID: 21, Page Parent: Top Page, Status: Visible). No visible loading spinner needed as response was immediate, demonstrating efficient loading

observations: The React-based UI provides a responsive and interactive page management interface
Page tree supports expand/collapse functionality with visual indicators [+] and [-]
Drag and drop functionality works smoothly for reorganizing page hierarchy
The search feature provides real-time filtering with detailed result cards
Form validation provides clear error messages and visual indicators for required fields
Confirmation dialogs protect against accidental data loss
The UI adapts to different screen sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop) maintaining functionality
Tab-based navigation (Details, Permissions, Advanced) provides organized access to different page settings
Workflow and Link Tracking React components are integrated into the page management interface
